{ PAST }

heavy Denim has a past

Tatsuya Nakatani, The Whale (April 11, 2014) —two sets at Hays Street Bridge (in collaboration with Resonant Interval): The Whale (Kory Cook, Eddie Vasquez, Justin Carney), Tastuya Nakatani.

No Idea Festival (February 23, 2014) —three sets at Southwest School of Art with after party at Tortilleria La Popular. More info here .

Marcus Rubio, Todd Lerew, Justin Boyd (December 19, 2013) —four sets at Tortilleria La Popular: Justin Boyd, Todd Lerew, Marcus Rubio + Todd Lerew, Marcus Rubio.

Marriage, James Woodard, Oltre la Morte (October 26, 2013) —four sets at Hays Street Bridge (in collaboration with Resonant Interval): James Woodard, Marriage, Oltre La Morte, freeform freakout with all artists.

No Idea Festival (February 20, 2013) —three sets at SMART Art Project Space . More info here.

Janet Feder, James Sidlo (November 4, 2012) —three sets at Hot Wells: James Sidlo, Janet Feder, Janet Feder + James Sidlo.

No Idea Festival (February 2, 2012) —four sets at SMART Art Project Space . More info here.

Frode Gjerstad Trio, The Whale (August 23, 2011) —two sets at SMART Art Project Space : Frode Gjerstad Trio (Frode Gjerstad, Paal Nilssen-Love, Rune Str√∏m), The Whale (Kory Cook, Eddie Vasquez).

No Idea Festival (January 27, 2011) —four sets at SMART Art Project Space : Damon Smith + Thomas Helton, LUCRE, Maggie Bennett, Nick Hennies + Alexander Bruck. More info here.

Shawn David McMillen, Christina Carter, Transsexuals (September 23, 2010) —three sets at Boneshakers.

Kamama, spokeNine, Putman/Rivas/Rubio/Woodard (July 6, 2010) —three sets at SMART Art Project Space : Kamama (duo: Audrey Chen and Luca Marini), spokeNine (solo: Jason Jay Stevens), Putman/Rivas/Rubio/Woodard (quartet).

Koboku Senju, Transsexuals + Philip Krumm, Marcus Rubio, Jane Henry (June 2, 2010) —four sets at SMART Art Project Space : Koboku Senju, Transsexuals + Philip Krumm, Marcus Rubio solo, Jane Henry + Marcus Rubio duo. Jeremy Martin wrote a review of Transsexuals + Philip Krumm.

Remi Alvarez + Ingebrigt H åker Flaten, Chris Cogburn + Jesse Kudler (January 13, 2010) —two sets at SMART Art Project Space : Remi Alvarez + Ingebrigt H åker Flaten duo, Chris Cogburn + Jesse Kudler duo.

Layne Garrett, Woodard + Trejo + Rivas, The Transsexuals, Sidlo + Allen (December 17, 2009) —four sets at SMART Art Project Space : Layne Garrett solo, James Woodard + Mario Trejo + Viridiana Rivas trio, The Transexuals, James Sidlo + Sanford Allen duo.

Jason Kahn, Annette Krebs + Chris Cogburn (February 21, 2009) —two sets at “Beauty College ”in collaboration with No Idea Festival , Contemporary Art Month , UTSA , and the Swiss Arts Council : Jason Kahn solo, Annette Krebs &Chris Cogburn duo.

Annette Krebs (February 20, 2009) —at Sala Diaz.

Crevice (February 14, 2009) —at the FLIGHT Gallery.

Giuseppe Ielasi + Michaela Grill with Potter-Belmar Labs (December 16, 2007) —Two sets: Giuseppe Ielasi (audio) / Michaela Grill (video), and Potter-Belmar Labs video screening.

Charalambides with Tetuzi Akiyama, Warmer Milks + Shawn David McMillen, Chris Cogburn (March 18, 2007) —Three sets: Charalambides, Shawn David McMillen/Warmer Milks, and Tetuzi Akiyama/Chris Cogburn/Tom Carter. Three videos of this concert were available on YouTube thanks to user narikiri, but they have since been deleted.

Han Bennink + Arthur Doyle (January 25, 2007) —In collaboration with KRTU . Three sets: Arthur Doyle solo, Han Bennink solo, and a duo set. Two short videos of this concert are now available on YouTube: Arthur Doyle solo , and the beginning of the duo set.

No Idea Festival (November 21, 2006) —Organized by Chris Cogburn. Four sets: Chris Cogburn, Dave Dove, Bhob Rainey, Suzanne Thorpe + Liz Tonne; Jeffrey Allport, Dave Dove + Annette Krebs; Jeffrey Allport, Chris Cogburn + Bhob Rainey; Annette Krebs, Suzanne Thorpe + Liz Tonne. Hope to make recording available soon. More information on the festival.

Tetuzi Akiyama + Alan Licht (June 6, 2006) —Three sets: Alan Licht solo on electric guitar, Tetuzi Akiyama solo on electric guitar (boogie set), and an acoustic / electric duo set. Hope to make recording available soon.

MV+EE Medicine Show (August 2, 2004) —Musical performance, screening of Temptation to Zoology, reading from Small as Life &Infinitesimally as Pure, exhibit of entire catalog of Child of Microtones releases + selected posters. Check a review by Lee. We now have the entire show (excluding the movie) available for download –recorded on Minidisc, transfered to CD, encoded to MP3 (at 192 kbps):

  • Part I (31 mins, 42.8 mb)
  • Part II (7 mins, 10.4 mb)
  • Part III (14 mins, 19.2 mb)

Thanks to Lee Jackson for the great recordings!
